t: Zechariah 1
In*p the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, came the word of the Lord*s unto Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,
The*p Lord*s hath been sore displeased with your fathers.
Therefore*p say thou unto them, Thus saith the Lord*s of hosts; Turn ye unto me, saith the Lord*s of hosts, and I will turn unto you, saith the Lord*s of hosts.

Be*p ye not as your fathers, unto whom the former prophets have cried, saying, Thus saith the Lord*s of hosts; Turn ye now from your evil ways, and from your evil doings: but they did not hear, nor hearken unto me, saith the Lord.*s
Your*p fathers, where are they? and the prophets, do they live for ever?

But*p my words and my statutes, which I commanded my servants the prophets, did they not take hold of your fathers? and they returned and said, Like as the Lord*s of hosts thought to do unto us, according to our ways, and according to our doings, so hath he dealt with us.

Upon*p the four and twentieth day of the eleventh month, which is the month Sebat, in the second year of Darius, came the word of the Lord*s unto Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,
I*p saw by night, and behold a man riding upon a red horse, and he stood among the myrtle trees that were in the bottom; and behind him were there red horses, speckled, and white.
Then*p said I, O my lord, what are these? And the angel that talked with me said unto me, I will shew thee what these be.
And*p the man that stood among the myrtle trees answered and said, These are they whom the Lord*s hath sent to walk to and fro through the earth.
And*p they answered the angel of the Lord*s that stood among the myrtle trees, and said, We have walked to and fro through the earth, and, behold, all the earth sitteth still, and is at rest.

Then*p the angel of the Lord*s answered and said, O Lord*s of hosts, how long wilt thou not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which thou hast had indignation these threescore and ten years?
And*p the Lord*s answered the angel that talked with me with good words and comfortable words.
So*p the angel that communed with me said unto me, Cry thou, saying, Thus saith the Lord*s of hosts; I am jealous for Jerusalem and for Zion with a great jealousy.
And*p I am very sore displeased with the heathen that are at ease: for I was but a little displeased, and they helped forward the affliction.
Therefore*p thus saith the Lord;*s I am returned to Jerusalem with mercies: my house shall be built in it, saith the Lord*s of hosts, and a line shall be stretched forth upon Jerusalem.
Cry*p yet, saying, Thus saith the Lord*s of hosts; My cities through prosperity shall yet be spread abroad; and the Lord*s shall yet comfort Zion, and shall yet choose Jerusalem.
Then*p lifted I up mine eyes, and saw, and behold four horns.
And*p I said unto the angel that talked with me, What be these? And he answered me, These are the horns which have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.
And*p the Lord*s shewed me four carpenters.

Then*p said I, What come these to do? And he spake, saying, These are the horns which have scattered Judah, so that no man did lift up his head: but these are come to fray them, to cast out the horns of the Gentiles, which lifted up their horn over the land of Judah to scatter it.
